title: Disk patterns, quasi-duality and the uniform bounded diameter conjecture
abstract:
We show that the diameter of the image of the skinning map on the deformation
space of an acylindrical reflection group is bounded by a constant depending
only on the topological complexity of the components of its boundary, answering
a conjecture of Minsky in the reflection group setting. This result can be
interpreted as a uniform rigidity theorem for disk patterns. Our method also
establishes a connection between the diameter of the skinning image and certain
discrete extremal width on the Coxeter graph of the reflection group.
